alert.note: Alert for Clinton; Jackson (Iowa) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS QuadCities (Eastern Iowa and Northwestern Illinois - Quad Cities)
info.headline: Flood Warning issued May 03 at 9:31PM CDT until May 11 at 10:00AM CDT by NWS QuadCities
info.description: ...The Flood Warning continues for the following rivers in Iowa... Illinois...Missouri... Mississippi River at Keokuk LD19 affecting Hancock, Lee and Clark Counties. Mississippi River at Bellevue LD12 affecting Jo Daviess, Jackson, Carroll and Clinton Counties. Mississippi River at Gregory Landing affecting Hancock and Clark Counties. Mississippi River at Keithsburg affecting Henderson, Louisa, Mercer and Des Moines Counties. Mississippi River at New Boston LD17 affecting Louisa and Mercer Counties. Mississippi River at Muscatine affecting Louisa, Mercer, Muscatine and Rock Island Counties. Mississippi River at Ill. City LD16 affecting Muscatine and Rock Island Counties. Mississippi River at Rock Island LD15 affecting Scott, Muscatine and Rock Island Counties. Mississippi River at Le Claire LD14 affecting Scott and Rock Island Counties. Mississippi River at Fulton LD13 affecting Whiteside, Carroll and Clinton Counties. Mississippi River at Camanche affecting Whiteside, Scott, Clinton and Rock Island Counties. Mississippi River at Burlington affecting Henderson, Hancock, Lee and Des Moines Counties. Mississippi River at Gladstone LD18 affecting Henderson and Des Moines Counties. Mississippi River at Dubuque LD11 affecting Dubuque and Jo Daviess Counties. Mississippi River at Dubuque affecting Dubuque, Jackson and Jo Daviess Counties. ...FLOOD WARNING NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL THURSDAY, MAY 11... * WHAT...Major flooding is occurring. * WHERE...Mississippi River at Bellevue LD12. * WHEN...Until Thursday, May 11. * IMPACTS...At 20.1 feet, Basement flooding occurs in homes and businesses with seepage into yards in Savanna. Grain elevators are also affected. Water affects the lower portion of Marquette Parking lot. Water affects Vulcan and South Broad Streets in Sabula. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 8:30 PM CDT Wednesday the stage was 20.5 feet and falling. - Forecast...The river is expected to fall below flood stage next Wednesday afternoon and continue falling to 16.9 feet by next Wednesday evening. - Flood stage is 17.0 feet. &&
info.instruction: Caution is urged when walking near riverbanks. Motorists should not attempt to drive around barricades or drive cars through flooded areas. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov/quadcities. The next statement will be issued early Thursday morning.
